name: NW.js
description: Access features only available when exported with NW.js, like accessing files on disk.

conditions.name: On open dialog OK
conditions.description: Triggered after a file chosen from an open dialog.

conditions.name: On folder dialog OK
conditions.description: Triggered after a folder chosen from a folder dialog.

conditions.name: On save dialog OK
conditions.description: Triggered after a file chosen from a save dialog.

conditions.name: On open dialog cancel
conditions.description: Triggered if the open dialog is cancelled.

conditions.name: On folder dialog cancel
conditions.description: Triggered if the folder dialog is cancelled.

conditions.name: On save dialog cancel
conditions.description: Triggered if the save dialog is cancelled.

conditions.name: Path exists
conditions.description: Test if a file exists on disk.

params.name: Path
params.description: Enter a file path to test if exists.

conditions.name: On file dropped
conditions.description: Triggered when the user drag-and-drops a file in to the window.

conditions.name: On binary file read
conditions.description: Triggered when binary file read completes. The data is then available in the Binary Data object.

params.name: Tag
params.description: A tag to distinguish between different file actions.

conditions.name: On binary file written
conditions.description: Triggered when a binary file write completes.

params.name: Tag
params.description: A tag to distinguish between different file actions.

conditions.name: On file system error
conditions.description: Triggered when a file operation fails.

conditions.name: On any binary file read
conditions.description: Triggered when any binary file read completes. The 'FileTag' expression identifies the action.

conditions.name: On any binary file written
conditions.description: Triggered when any binary file write completes. The 'FileTag' expression identifies the action.

actions.name: Show open dialog
actions.description: Show an open file dialog allowing the user to pick a file.

params.name: Accept
params.description: The file types to filter by. Leave empty to show all files, or e.g. ".txt" or ".txt,.json" or "text/*"

actions.name: Show folder dialog
actions.description: Show a folder picker dialog allowing the user to pick a folder.

actions.name: Show save dialog
actions.description: Show a save file dialog.

params.name: Accept
params.description: The file types to filter by. Leave empty to show all files, or e.g. ".txt" or ".txt,.json" or "text/*"

actions.name: Write text file
actions.description: Write some text to a file.

params.name: Path
params.description: Enter the file path to write to. The file will be overwritten!

params.name: Contents
params.description: Enter the text content to write to the file.

actions.name: Rename file
actions.description: Rename an existing file.

params.name: Existing file
params.description: Enter the existing file path to be renamed.

params.name: New name
params.description: Enter the new file path to rename to.

actions.name: Delete file
actions.description: Delete a file.

params.name: Path
params.description: Enter the file path to delete.

actions.name: Create folder
actions.description: Create a new folder on disk.

params.name: Path
params.description: Enter the folder path to create.

actions.name: Append file
actions.description: Add some text to the end of a file.

params.name: Path
params.description: Enter the file path to append to.

params.name: Contents
params.description: Enter the text content to append to the file.

actions.name: List files
actions.description: Load a list of files in a given folder. Use expressions after this action to get the count and file names.

params.name: Path
params.description: Enter the folder path to list files from.

actions.name: Copy file
actions.description: Make an identical copy of a file.

params.name: Path
params.description: Enter the file path to copy.

params.name: Destination
params.description: Enter the file path to copy to.

actions.name: Move file
actions.description: Copy a file then delete the original.

params.name: Path
params.description: Enter the file path to move.

params.name: Destination
params.description: Enter the file path to move to.

actions.name: Run file
actions.description: Run a file, such as executing another program.

params.name: Path
params.description: Enter the path of the file to execute. This can also include space-separated arguments. To execute a path with spaces in it, wrap in double-quotes (e.g. """C:\Program Files\file.exe""").

actions.name: Open browser
actions.description: Open the default browser to a given URL.

params.name: URL
params.description: The web address to open in a browser.

actions.name: Set X
actions.description: Set the X position of the window on the screen.

params.name: X
params.description: The X co-ordinate to move the window to on the screen.

actions.name: Set Y
actions.description: Set the Y position of the window on the screen.

params.name: Y
params.description: The Y co-ordinate to move the window to on the screen.

actions.name: Set width
actions.description: Set the width of the window.

params.name: Width
params.description: The new width of the window.

actions.name: Set height
actions.description: Set the height of the window.

params.name: Height
params.description: The new height of the window.

actions.name: Set title
actions.description: Set the text appearing in the window title bar.

params.name: Title
params.description: A string to display in the window title bar.

actions.name: Minimize
actions.description: Minimize the window.

actions.name: Maximize
actions.description: Maximize the window.

actions.name: Unmaximize
actions.description: Unmaximize the window (i.e. the reverse of maximizing).

actions.name: Restore
actions.description: Restore the window (i.e. show again after minimizing).

actions.name: Request attention
actions.description: Start or stop requesting attention from the user, e.g. by flashing the title bar (depends on OS).

params.name: Mode
params.description: Whether to request attention or cancel a previous request for attention.

actions.name: Set maximum size
actions.description: Set the maximum size of the window.
actions.display_text: Set window maximum size to [i]{0}[/i] x [i]{1}[/i]

params.name: Max width
params.description: The maximum window width to set, in pixels.

params.name: Max height
params.description: The maximum window height to set, in pixels.

actions.name: Set minimum size
actions.description: Set the minimum size of the window.
actions.display_text: Set window minimum size to [i]{0}[/i] x [i]{1}[/i]

params.name: Min width
params.description: The minimum window width to set, in pixels.

params.name: Min height
params.description: The minimum window height to set, in pixels.

actions.name: Set resizable
actions.description: Enable or disable resize controls on the window.

params.name: Mode
params.description: Whether to enable or disable resizing on the window.

actions.name: Set always on top
actions.description: Enable or disable the window always being on top of other windows.

params.name: Mode
params.description: Whether to enable or disable the window always being on top.

actions.name: Show dev tools
actions.description: Display the web developer tools e.g. for Javascript debugging or inspecting console messages.

actions.name: Shell open
actions.description: Open the default associated app for a file.

params.name: Path
params.description: File path to open. The default app associated with the file will be opened.

actions.name: Read binary file
actions.description: Read a file into a Binary Data object. Triggers 'On binary file read' when completed.

params.name: Tag
params.description: A tag to distinguish between different file operations.

params.name: Path
params.description: Enter the file path to read from.

params.name: Destination
params.description: The Binary Data object to read data in to.

actions.name: Write binary file
actions.description: Write a BinaryData object to a file.

params.name: Tag
params.description: A tag to distinguish between different file actions.

params.name: Path
params.description: Enter the file path to write to. The file will be overwritten!

params.name: Source
params.description: The Binary Data object to write into the file.

expressions.name: ChosenPath
expressions.description: Return the chosen path after a file dialog.

expressions.name: AppFolder
expressions.description: Return the application's folder path. Note it may not have write permission.

expressions.name: AppFolderURL
expressions.description: Return the application's folder as a file URL. Use this for any URL parameters.

expressions.name: UserFolder
expressions.description: Return the current user's folder.

expressions.name: ReadFile
expressions.description: Return the text content of a file on disk.

params.name: Path
params.description: The file path to load.

expressions.name: FileSize
expressions.description: Return the size of a file on disk, in bytes.

params.name: Path
params.description: The file path to get the size of.

expressions.name: ListCount
expressions.description: Return the number of files after 'List files'.

expressions.name: ListAt
expressions.description: Return the filename at an index after 'List files'.

params.name: Index
params.description: Zero-based index of file to retrieve.

expressions.name: DroppedFile
expressions.description: Return the filename of a file dropped in to the window.

expressions.name: WindowX
expressions.description: The X position of the window on the screen.

expressions.name: WindowY
expressions.description: The Y position of the window on the screen.

expressions.name: WindowWidth
expressions.description: The width of the UI window in the operating system.

expressions.name: WindowHeight
expressions.description: The height of the UI window in the operating system.

expressions.name: WindowTitle
expressions.description: The current window title bar text.

expressions.name: ProjectFilesFolder
expressions.description: Return the folder path to project files (i.e. where index.html is). Note it may not have write permission.

expressions.name: ProjectFilesFolderURL
expressions.description: Return the folder path to project files as a file URL. Use this for any URL parameters.

expressions.name: ArgumentCount
expressions.description: The number of command-line arguments.

expressions.name: ArgumentAt
expressions.description: The command-line argument at an index.

params.name: Index
params.description: Zero-based index of argument

expressions.name: FileError
expressions.description: In 'On file system error', the related error message.

expressions.name: FileTag
expressions.description: Tag of a corresponding action in a trigger.
